RN   [24]
RP   INVOLVEMENT IN IMD52.
RX   PubMed=27522155; DOI=10.1016/j.jaci.2016.05.036;
RA   Bacchelli C., Moretti F.A., Carmo M., Adams S., Stanescu H.C.,
RA   Pearce K., Madkaikar M., Gilmour K.C., Nicholas A.K., Woods C.G.,
RA   Kleta R., Beales P.L., Qasim W., Gaspar H.B.;
RT   "Mutations in linker for activation of T cells (LAT) lead to a novel
RT   form of severe combined immunodeficiency.";
RL   J. Allergy Clin. Immunol. 139:634-642(2017).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for TCR (T-cell antigen receptor)- and pre-TCR-
CC       mediated signaling, both in mature T-cells and during their
CC       development. Involved in FCGR3 (low affinity immunoglobulin gamma
CC       Fc region receptor III)-mediated signaling in natural killer cells
CC       and FCER1 (high affinity immunoglobulin epsilon receptor)-mediated
CC       signaling in mast cells. Couples activation of these receptors and
CC       their associated kinases with distal intracellular events such as
CC       mobilization of intracellular calcium stores, PKC activation, MAPK
CC       activation or cytoskeletal reorganization through the recruitment
CC       of PLCG1, GRB2, GRAP2, and other signaling molecules.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10072481}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: When phosphorylated, interacts directly with the PIK3R1
CC       subunit of phosphoinositide 3-kinase and the SH2 domains of GRB2,
CC       GRAP, GRAP2, PLCG1 and PLCG2. Interacts indirectly with CBL, SOS,
CC       VAV, and LCP2. Interacts with SHB, SKAP2 and CLNK (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with FCGR1A. Interacts with GRB2, PLCG1 and THEMIS upon
CC       TCR activation in thymocytes (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P00533:EGFR; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-1222766, EBI-297353;
CC       P62993:GRB2; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-1222766, EBI-401755;
CC       P62993-1:GRB2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-8070286, EBI-15787932;
CC       P06239:LCK; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-1222766, EBI-1348;
CC       P50222:MEOX2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-8070286, EBI-748397;
CC       P27986:PIK3R1; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-1222766, EBI-79464;
CC       P08487:PLCG1 (xeno); NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-8070286, EBI-8013886;
CC       P19174:PLCG1; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-1222766, EBI-79387;
CC       P18031:PTPN1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1222766, EBI-968788;
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1222766, EBI-347996;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9489702,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9729044}; Single-pass type III membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9489702, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9729044}.
CC       Note=Present in lipid rafts.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Long;
CC         IsoId=O43561-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Short;
CC         IsoId=O43561-2; Sequence=VSP_004303;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=O43561-3; Sequence=VSP_054758, VSP_004303;
CC         Note=Gene prediction based on EST data.;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=O43561-4; Sequence=VSP_054759, VSP_004303;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=O43561-5; Sequence=VSP_054759;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in thymus, T-cells, NK cells, mast
CC       cells and, at lower levels, in spleen. Present in T-cells but not
CC       B-cells (at protein level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16160011,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9489702}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on tyrosines by ZAP70 upon TCR activation, or
CC       by SYK upon other immunoreceptor activation; which leads to the
CC       recruitment of multiple signaling molecules. Is one of the most
CC       prominently tyrosine-phosphorylated proteins detected following
CC       TCR engagement. May be dephosphorylated by PTPRJ. Phosphorylated
CC       by ITK leading to the recruitment of VAV1 to LAT-containing
CC       complexes.
CC   -!- PTM: Palmitoylation of Cys-26 and Cys-29 is required for raft
CC       targeting and efficient phosphorylation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9729044}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Immunodeficiency 52 (IMD52) [MIM:617514]: An autosomal
CC       recessive primary immunodeficiency characterized by T-cell
CC       abnormalities, resulting in severe combined immunodeficiency,
CC       autoimmune disease, progressive lymphopenia and
CC       hypogammaglobulinemia, and lymphoproliferation with splenomegaly.
CC       Patients develop severe recurrent infections from infancy.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27242165, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27522155}.
CC       Note=The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene
CC       represented in this entry.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Engagement of killer inhibitory receptors (KIR)
CC       disrupts the interaction of PLCG1 with LAT and blocks target cell-
CC       induced activation of PLC, maybe by inducing the dephosphorylation
CC       of LAT.

RP   CHARACTERIZATION OF VARIANT ETL8 GLU-39.
RX   PubMed=25691535; DOI=10.1093/hmg/ddv060;
RA   Guipponi M., Chentouf A., Webling K.E., Freimann K., Crespel A.,
RA   Nobile C., Lemke J.R., Hansen J., Dorn T., Lesca G., Ryvlin P.,

RT   "Galanin pathogenic mutations in temporal lobe epilepsy.";
RL   Hum. Mol. Genet. 24:3082-3091(2015).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Endocrine hormone of the central and peripheral nervous
CC       systems that binds and activates the G protein-coupled receptors
CC       GALR1, GALR2, and GALR3. This small neuropeptide may regulate
CC       diverse physiologic functions including contraction of smooth
CC       muscle of the gastrointestinal and genitourinary tract, growth
CC       hormone and insulin release and adrenal secretion.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1370155, ECO:0000269|PubMed:1722333,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25691535}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P47211:GALR1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-6624800, EBI-6624741;
CC       O43603:GALR2; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-6624800, EBI-6624855;
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-6624768, EBI-347996;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1370155,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:1722333}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Epilepsy, familial temporal lobe, 8 (ETL8) [MIM:616461]:
CC       A focal form of epilepsy characterized by recurrent seizures that
CC       arise from foci within the temporal lobe. Seizures are usually
CC       accompanied by sensory symptoms, most often auditory in nature.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25691535}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the galanin family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the dehydration of the S-form of NAD(P)HX at
CC       the expense of ATP, which is converted to ADP. Together with
CC       NAD(P)HX epimerase, which catalyzes the epimerization of the
CC       S- and R-forms, the enzyme allows the repair of both epimers of
CC       NAD(P)HX, a damaged form of NAD(P)H that is a result of enzymatic
CC       or heat-dependent hydration. {ECO:0000256|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03157}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + (6S)-6-beta-hydroxy-1,4,5,6-
CC       tetrahydronicotinamide-adenine dinucleotide = ADP + phosphate +
CC       NADH. {ECO:0000256|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03157}.

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=24275569; DOI=10.1016/j.jprot.2013.11.014;
RA   Bian Y., Song C., Cheng K., Dong M., Wang F., Huang J., Sun D.,
RA   Wang L., Ye M., Zou H.;
RT   "An enzyme assisted RP-RPLC approach for in-depth analysis of human
RT   liver phosphoproteome.";
RL   J. Proteomics 96:253-262(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the dehydration of the S-form of NAD(P)HX at
CC       the expense of ATP, which is converted to ADP. Together with
CC       NAD(P)HX epimerase, which catalyzes the epimerization of the
CC       S- and R-forms, the enzyme allows the repair of both epimers of
CC       NAD(P)HX, a damaged form of NAD(P)H that is a result of enzymatic
CC       or heat-dependent hydration. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03157}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + (6S)-6-beta-hydroxy-1,4,5,6-
CC       tetrahydronicotinamide-adenine dinucleotide = ADP + phosphate +
CC       NADH. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03157}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + (6S)-6-beta-hydroxy-1,4,5,6-
CC       tetrahydronicotinamide-adenine dinucleotide phosphate = ADP +
CC       phosphate + NADPH.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=25944712; DOI=10.1002/pmic.201400617;
RA   Vaca Jacome A.S., Rabilloud T., Schaeffer-Reiss C., Rompais M.,

RT   "N-terminome analysis of the human mitochondrial proteome.";

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Bone marrow-derived monocyte and paracrine-acting
CC       protein that promotes cardiac myocyte survival and adaptive
CC       angiogenesis for cardiac protection and/or repair after myocardial
CC       infarction (MI). Stimulates endothelial cell proliferation through
CC       a MAPK1/3-, STAT3- and CCND1-mediated signaling pathway. Inhibits
CC       cardiac myocyte apoptosis in a PI3K/AKT-dependent signaling
CC       pathway (By similarity). Involved in endothelial cell
CC       proliferation and angiogenesis (PubMed:25581518).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9CPT4, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25581518}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q9NPJ3:ACOT13; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-718622, EBI-1045357;
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-718622, EBI-347996;
CC       Q9UHD9:UBQLN2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-718622, EBI-947187;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17362502,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25581518}. Endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi
CC       intermediate compartment {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17362502}.
CC       Note=Secreted into blood plasma. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25581518}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in bone marrow cells
CC       (PubMed:25581518). Expressed in synovial tissue. Found in synovial
CC       fluid of patients with arthropaties (PubMed:17362502).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17362502, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25581518}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated in response to myocardial infarction (MI).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25581518}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the MYDGF family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Was originally thought to signal lymphoid cells to
CC       proliferate via thymic shared antigen 1, but this work has been
CC       later retracted (PubMed:11714798, PubMed:12538725).
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:11714798, ECO:0000305|PubMed:12538725}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAC27824.1; Type=Erroneous gene model prediction; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=AAC33800.1; Type=Erroneous gene model prediction; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Calcium-dependent cell-adhesion protein involved in
CC       cells self-recognition and non-self discrimination. Thereby, it is
CC       involved in the establishment and maintenance of specific neuronal
CC       connections in the brain. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O88689}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms homodimers in trans (molecules expressed by two
CC       different cells). Forms promiscuous heterodimers in cis (at the
CC       plasma membrane of the same cell) with other protocadherins.
CC       Interacts with FYN. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O88689}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-712273, EBI-347996;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O88689}; Single-pass type I membrane
CC       protein {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O88689}. Note=Detected in dendrites
CC       and synapses. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O88689}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9UN74-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9UN74-2; Sequence=VSP_000677, VSP_000678;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Cadherin 1 to cadherin 4 domains mediate homophilic trans-
CC       interaction, the interaction with an identical protocadherin
CC       expressed by a neighboring cell. This is a head-to-tail
CC       interaction, the cadherin 1 domain interacting with the cadherin 4
CC       domain and the cadherin 2 domain interacting the cadherin 3 domain
CC       of the other protocadherin. The cadherin 6 domain mediates
CC       promiscuous interactions with protocadherins on the same cell
CC       membrane. Each cadherin domain binds three calcium ions.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O88689}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA] (ISOFORM 1).
RC   TISSUE=Lung;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;
RG   The MGC Project Team;
RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: May be involved in dorsoventral axis formation. Seems to
CC       antagonize BMP signaling by forming ternary complexes with CHRD
CC       and BMPs, thereby preventing BMPs from binding to their receptors.
CC       In addition to the anti-BMP function, also has pro-BMP activity,
CC       partly mediated by cleavage and degradation of CHRD, which
CC       releases BMPs from ternary complexes. May be an important
CC       modulator of BMP-regulated cartilage development and chondrocyte
CC       differentiation. May play a role in thymocyte development (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with CHRD and BMP4. This interaction enhances
CC       CHRD/BMP4 complex formation. Interacts with BMP7 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-10304067, EBI-347996;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9GZX9-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9GZX9-2; Sequence=VSP_042538, VSP_042539;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available. May be produced at
CC         very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA,
CC         leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.;
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed in brain throughout development.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11420619}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The N-terminal domain is sufficient to interact with BMP4.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the twisted gastrulation protein family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAB55246.1; Type=Erroneous translation; Note=Wrong choice of CDS.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May play a role in epithelial cell-cell contacts. May
CC       play a role in tumor invasiveness and metastasis formation.

CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15021913};
CC       Single-pass type III membrane protein {ECO:0000255}. Cytoplasmic
CC       vesicle membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15986429}; Single-pass type
CC       III membrane protein {ECO:0000255}. Note=Predominantly on lateral
CC       parts of the membrane, at cell-cell epithelial junctions
CC       (PubMed:15021913). Detected on cytoplasmic membranes in
CC       undifferentiated tumors (PubMed:15986429).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15021913, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15986429}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in breast, endometrium, colon and
CC       biliary tract. Detected in polarized epithelial structures
CC       characterized by cell-cell adhesion (at protein level).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15021913}.
CC   -!- PTM: O-glycosylated. The O-glycan is modified with sialic acid
CC       residues. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15021913}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SMAGP family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Regulator of pre-B-cell leukemia transcription factors
CC       (BPXs) function. Inhibits the binding of PBX1-HOX complex to DNA
CC       and blocks the transcriptional activity of E2A-PBX1. Tethers
CC       estrogen receptor-alpha (ESR1) to microtubules and allows them to
CC       influence estrogen receptors-alpha signaling.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10825160, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12360403,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17043237}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with TEX11 (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       ESR1, PBX1, PBX2 and PBX3. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10825160, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17043237}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P49069:CAMLG; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-1748958;
CC       P24863:CCNC; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-395261;
CC       Q9UER7:DAXX; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-77321;
CC       Q9H4E7:DEF6; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-745369;
CC       P03372:ESR1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-15606280, EBI-78473;
CC       P03372-1:ESR1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-15606280, EBI-15606245;
CC       Q53SE7:FLJ13057; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-10172181;
CC       Q9UBU8:MORF4L1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-399246;
CC       Q9UBU8-2:MORF4L1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-10288852;
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-347996;
CC       Q9UMX0-2:UBQLN1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-10173939;
CC       Q9Y3C0:WASHC3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-740845, EBI-712969;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12360403, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17043237}.
CC       Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10825160,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12360403}. Note=Shuttles between the nucleus
CC       and the cytosol (PubMed:12360403). Mainly localized in the
CC       cytoplasm, associated with microtubules (PubMed:10825160,
CC       PubMed:12360403). Detected in small amounts in the nucleus
CC       (PubMed:10825160).
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;

CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q96AQ6-2; Sequence=VSP_028418;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q96AQ6-3; Sequence=VSP_028419;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in early hematopoietic precursors.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10825160}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The C-terminal domain (AA 443-731) contains a nuclear
CC       export signal.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Association to the cytoskeleton through a N-terminal
CC       leucine rich-domain (AA 190-218).

RN   [23]
RP   INTERACTION WITH CPSF6 AND CPSF7, AND DOMAIN.
RX   PubMed=29276085; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2017.11.031;
RA   Zhu Y., Wang X., Forouzmand E., Jeong J., Qiao F., Sowd G.A.,
RA   Engelman A.N., Xie X., Hertel K.J., Shi Y.;
RT   "Molecular mechanisms for CFIm-mediated regulation of mRNA alternative
RT   polyadenylation.";
RL   Mol. Cell 69:62-74(2018).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation
CC       specificity factor (CPSF) complex that plays a key role in pre-
CC       mRNA 3'-end formation, recognizing the AAUAAA signal sequence and
CC       interacting with poly(A) polymerase and other factors to bring
CC       about cleavage and poly(A) addition. FIP1L1 contributes to poly(A)
CC       site recognition and stimulates poly(A) addition. Binds to U-rich
CC       RNA sequence elements surrounding the poly(A) site. May act to
CC       tether poly(A) polymerase to the CPSF complex.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14749727}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation specificity
CC       factor (CPSF) complex, composed of CPSF1, CPSF2, CPSF3, CPSF4 and
CC       FIP1L1. Found in a complex with CPSF1, FIP1L1 and PAPOLA.
CC       Interacts with CPSF1, CPSF4, CSTF2 and CSTF3 (PubMed:14749727).
CC       Interacts with AHCYL1 (when phosphorylated); the interaction is
CC       direct and associates AHCYL1 with the CPSF complex and RNA
CC       (PubMed:19224921). Interacts with NUDT21/CPSF5; this interaction
CC       occurs in a RNA sequence-specific manner (PubMed:15937220).
CC       Interacts (preferentially via unphosphorylated form and
CC       Arg/Glu/Asp-rich domain) with CPSF6 (via Arg/Ser-rich domain);
CC       this interaction mediates, at least in part, the interaction
CC       between the CFIm and CPSF complexes and may be inhibited by CPSF6
CC       hyper-phosphorylation (PubMed:29276085). Interacts (preferentially
CC       via unphosphorylated form and Arg/Asp/Glu-rich domain) with CPSF7
CC       (via Arg/Ser-rich domain); this interaction mediates, at least in
CC       part, the interaction between the CFIm and CPSF complexes and may
CC       be inhibited by CPSF7 hyper-phosphorylation (PubMed:29276085).
CC       Interacts with PAPOLA; the interaction seems to be increased by
CC       the interaction with AHCYL1 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9D824, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14749727,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15937220, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19224921,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:29276085}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q08379:GOLGA2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1021914, EBI-618309;
CC       P41227:NAA10; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1021914, EBI-747693;
CC       Q96E35:ZMYND19; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1021914, EBI-746595;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE GENOMIC DNA].
RA   Mural R.J., Istrail S., Sutton G.G., Florea L., Halpern A.L.,
RA   Mobarry C.M., Lippert R., Walenz B., Shatkay H., Dew I., Miller J.R.,
RA   Flanigan M.J., Edwards N.J., Bolanos R., Fasulo D., Halldorsson B.V.,
RA   Hannenhalli S., Turner R., Yooseph S., Lu F., Nusskern D.R.,

RA   Kravitz S.A., Mouchard L., Reinert K., Remington K.A., Clark A.G.,
RA   Waterman M.S., Eichler E.E., Adams M.D., Hunkapiller M.W., Myers E.W.,
RA   Venter J.C.;
RL   Submitted (JUL-2005) to the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.
RN   [4]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA], AND VARIANT GLN-129.
RC   TISSUE=Brain;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;
RG   The MGC Project Team;
RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: As a component of the LINC (LInker of Nucleoskeleton and
CC       Cytoskeleton) complex, involved in the connection between the
CC       nuclear lamina and the cytoskeleton. The nucleocytoplasmic
CC       interactions established by the LINC complex play an important
CC       role in the transmission of mechanical forces across the nuclear
CC       envelope and in nuclear movement and positioning. Required for
CC       telomere attachment to nuclear envelope in the prophase of meiosis
CC       and for rapid telomere prophase movements implicating a
CC       SUN1/2:KASH5 LINC complex in which SUN1 and SUN2 seem to act at
CC       least partial redundantly. Required for homologue pairing during
CC       meiotic prophase in spermatocytes and probably oocytes. Essential
CC       for male and female gametogenesis. Recruits cytoplasmic dynein to
CC       telomere attachment sites at the nuclear envelope in
CC       spermatocytes. In oocytes is involved in meiotic resumption and
CC       spindle formation. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q80VJ8}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Core component the LINC complex which is composed of
CC       inner nuclear membrane SUN domain-containing proteins coupled to
CC       outer nuclear membrane KASH domain-containing nesprins. SUN and
CC       KASH domain-containing proteins seem to bind each other
CC       promiscuously; however, differentially expression of LINC complex
CC       constituents is giving rise to specific assemblies. At least
CC       SUN1/2-containing core LINC complexes are proposed to be hexameric
CC       composed of three protomers of each KASH and SUN domain-containing
CC       protein. Interacts (via the last 22 AA) with SUN1; this
CC       interaction mediates its telomere localization by forming a
CC       SUN1:KASH5 LINC complex. Component of a probable SUN2:KASH5 LINC
CC       complex. Self-associates. Interacts with DYNC1H1, DCTN1, DYNC1I1/2
CC       and PAFAH1B1; suggesting the association with the dynein-dynactin
CC       motor complex. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q80VJ8}.

RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.83 ANGSTROMS) OF 24-166.
RA   Nguyen V.D., Ruddock L.W., Salin M., Wierenga R.K.;
RT   "Crystal structure of the human anterior gradient protein 3.";
RL   Submitted (NOV-2010) to the PDB data bank.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for calcium-mediated regulation of ciliary beat
CC       frequency and mucociliary clearance in the airway. Might be
CC       involved in the regulation of intracellular calcium in tracheal
CC       epithelial cells. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8R3W7}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with LYPD3 and DAG1 (alphaDAG1).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12592373}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O75477:ERLIN1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-3925742, EBI-359299;
CC       P37198:NUP62; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-3925742, EBI-347978;
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-3925742, EBI-347996;
CC       Q9UMX0:UBQLN1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-3925742, EBI-741480;
CC       Q9UMX0-2:UBQLN1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-3925742, EBI-10173939;
CC       Q9UHD9:UBQLN2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-3925742, EBI-947187;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18086916, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25751668}.
CC       Note=Found in the cytoplasm, which could include the endoplasmic
CC       reticulum. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:26170690}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in the lung, in the ciliated cells
CC       of the airway epithelium (PubMed:25751668). Expression increased
CC       with differentiation of airway epithelial cells (PubMed:25751668).
CC       Not detected in the mucous cells (PubMed:25751668). Expressed in
CC       ciliated cells in the oviduct (PubMed:26170690). Also detected in
CC       stomach, colon, prostate and liver (PubMed:25751668). Expressed in
CC       breast, ovary, prostate and liver cancer (PubMed:26170690).
CC       Expression is associated with the level of differentiation of
CC       breast cancer (at protein level) (PubMed:26170690).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25751668, ECO:0000269|PubMed:26170690}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Not induced as part of the cellular response to
CC       endoplasmic reticulum stress (PubMed:25751668). Up-regulated by
CC       androgens and by estrogens in prostate cancer cells
CC       (PubMed:23294566) Up-regulated by a hormone (estrogen-receptor
CC       alpha) independent mechanism in ovarian cancer (PubMed:22361111).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22361111, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23294566,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25751668}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the AGR family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transcription factor that binds to the E-box and
CC       functions as inhibitor of transcription. DNA binding requires
CC       dimerization with an E protein. Inhibits transcription activation
CC       by ASCL1/MASH1 by sequestering E proteins (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer with TCF3/E12. Interacts with the bHLH domain
CC       of TCF3/E12 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May play a role in protein trafficking. May act as a
CC       linker molecule between the submembranous matrix on the luminal
CC       side of zymogen granule membrane (ZGM) and aggregated secretory
CC       proteins during granule formation in the TGN.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17307141}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q9UHX1:PUF60; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-746479, EBI-1053259;
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=8; IntAct=EBI-746479, EBI-347996;
CC       Q96EQ0:SGTB; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-746479, EBI-744081;
CC       Q9UMX0:UBQLN1; NbExp=8; IntAct=EBI-746479, EBI-741480;
CC       Q9UMX0-2:UBQLN1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-746479, EBI-10173939;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, extracellular space, extracellular
CC       matrix {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17307141}. Cytoplasmic vesicle lumen
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:17307141}. Golgi apparatus lumen
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17307141}. Note=Stored in zymogen granules.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in liver. Detected at lower
CC       levels in colon, ileum and jejunum. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17307141}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the jacalin lectin family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01088, ECO:0000305}.

RP   VARIANTS GCCR SER-477; CYS-478 AND PRO-672, CHARACTERIZATION OF

RX   PubMed=27120390; DOI=10.1002/humu.23008;
RA   Vitellius G., Fagart J., Delemer B., Amazit L., Ramos N.,
RA   Bouligand J., Le Billan F., Castinetti F., Guiochon-Mantel A.,
RA   Trabado S., Lombes M.;
RT   "Three novel heterozygous point mutations of NR3C1 causing
RT   glucocorticoid resistance.";
RL   Hum. Mutat. 37:794-803(2016).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Receptor for glucocorticoids (GC) (PubMed:27120390). Has
CC       a dual mode of action: as a transcription factor that binds to
CC       glucocorticoid response elements (GRE), both for nuclear and
CC       mitochondrial DNA, and as a modulator of other transcription
CC       factors. Affects inflammatory responses, cellular proliferation
CC       and differentiation in target tissues. Involved in chromatin
CC       remodeling (PubMed:9590696). Plays a role in rapid mRNA
CC       degradation by binding to the 5' UTR of target mRNAs and
CC       interacting with PNRC2 in a ligand-dependent manner which recruits
CC       the RNA helicase UPF1 and the mRNA-decapping enzyme DCP1A, leading
CC       to RNA decay (PubMed:25775514). Could act as a coactivator for
CC       STAT5-dependent transcription upon growth hormone (GH) stimulation
CC       and could reveal an essential role of hepatic GR in the control of
CC       body growth (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06537,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25775514, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27120390,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9590696}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha: Has transcriptional activation and
CC       repression activity (PubMed:15866175, PubMed:19248771,
CC       PubMed:20484466, PubMed:23820903, PubMed:11435610,
CC       PubMed:15769988, PubMed:17635946, PubMed:19141540,
CC       PubMed:21664385). Mediates glucocorticoid-induced apoptosis
CC       (PubMed:23303127). Promotes accurate chromosome segregation during
CC       mitosis (PubMed:25847991). May act as a tumor suppressor
CC       (PubMed:25847991). May play a negative role in adipogenesis
CC       through the regulation of lipolytic and antilipogenic gene
CC       expression (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06537,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11435610, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15769988,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17635946,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19141540, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19248771,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20484466, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21664385,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23303127, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23820903,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25847991}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Beta: Acts as a dominant negative inhibitor of
CC       isoform Alpha (PubMed:7769088, PubMed:8621628, PubMed:20484466).
CC       Has intrinsic transcriptional activity independent of isoform
CC       Alpha when both isoforms are coexpressed (PubMed:19248771,
CC       PubMed:26711253). Loses this transcription modulator function on
CC       its own (PubMed:20484466). Has no hormone-binding activity
CC       (PubMed:8621628). May play a role in controlling glucose
CC       metabolism by maintaining insulin sensitivity (By similarity).
CC       Reduces hepatic gluconeogenesis through down-regulation of PEPCK
CC       in an isoform Alpha-dependent manner (PubMed:26711253). Directly
CC       regulates STAT1 expression in isoform Alpha-independent manner
CC       (PubMed:26711253). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06537,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19248771, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20484466,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:26711253, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7769088,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8621628}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-2: Has lower transcriptional activation
CC       activity than isoform Alpha. Exerts a dominant negative effect on
CC       isoform Alpha trans-repression mechanism (PubMed:20484466).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform GR-P: Increases activity of isoform Alpha.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11358809}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-B: More effective than isoform Alpha in
CC       transcriptional activation, but not repression activity.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11435610, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform 10: Has transcriptional activation activity.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20484466}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-C1: Has transcriptional activation
CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-C2: Has transcriptional activation
CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-C3: Has highest transcriptional activation
CC       activity of all isoforms created by alternative initiation
CC       (PubMed:15866175, PubMed:23820903). Has transcriptional repression
CC       activity (PubMed:23303127). Mediates glucocorticoid-induced
CC       apoptosis (PubMed:23303127, PubMed:23820903).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23303127,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23820903}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-D1: Has transcriptional activation
CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-D2: Has transcriptional activation
CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform Alpha-D3: Has lowest transcriptional activation
CC       activity of all isoforms created by alternative initiation
CC       (PubMed:15866175, PubMed:23820903). Has transcriptional repression
CC       activity (PubMed:23303127). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23303127, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23820903}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heteromultimeric cytoplasmic complex with HSP90AA1,
CC       HSPA1A/HSPA1B, and FKBP5 or another immunophilin such as PPID,
CC       STIP1, or the immunophilin homolog PPP5C (PubMed:21730050). Upon
CC       ligand binding FKBP5 dissociates from the complex and FKBP4 takes
CC       its place, thereby linking the complex to dynein and mediating
CC       transport to the nucleus, where the complex dissociates (By
CC       similarity). Probably forms a complex composed of chaperones HSP90
CC       and HSP70, co-chaperones CDC37, PPP5C, TSC1 and client protein
CC       TSC2, CDK4, AKT, RAF1 and NR3C1; this complex does not contain co-
CC       chaperones STIP1/HOP and PTGES3/p23 (PubMed:29127155). Directly
CC       interacts with UNC45A (PubMed:16478993). Binds to DNA as a
CC       homodimer, and as heterodimer with NR3C2 or the retinoid X
CC       receptor. Binds STAT5A and STAT5B homodimers and heterodimers (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with NRIP1, POU2F1, POU2F2 and TRIM28 (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with several coactivator complexes,
CC       including the SMARCA4 complex, CREBBP/EP300, TADA2L (Ada complex)
CC       and p160 coactivators such as NCOA2 and NCOA6 (PubMed:10866662,
CC       PubMed:12151000, PubMed:12686538, PubMed:9154805, PubMed:9590696).
CC       Interaction with BAG1 inhibits transactivation (PubMed:10477749).
CC       Interacts with HEXIM1, PELP1 and TGFB1I1 (PubMed:12415108,
CC       PubMed:15211577, PubMed:15941832). Interacts with NCOA1
CC       (PubMed:9590696). Interacts with NCOA3, SMARCA4, SMARCC1, SMARCD1,
CC       and SMARCE1 (By similarity). Interacts with CLOCK, CRY1 and CRY2
CC       in a ligand-dependent fashion (PubMed:19141540, PubMed:21980503,
CC       PubMed:22170608). Interacts with CIART (By similarity). Interacts
CC       with RWDD3 (By similarity). Interacts with UBE2I/UBC9 and this
CC       interaction is enhanced in the presence of RWDD3 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with GRIP1 (PubMed:15769988, PubMed:17635946). Interacts
CC       with NR4A3 (via nuclear receptor DNA-binding domain), represses
CC       transcription activity of NR4A3 on the POMC promoter Nur response
CC       element (NurRE) (PubMed:15591535). Directly interacts with PNRC2
CC       to attract and form a complex with UPF1 and DCP1A; the interaction
CC       leads to rapid mRNA degradation (PubMed:25775514). Interacts with
CC       GSK3B (PubMed:18838540). Interacts with FNIP1 and FNIP2
CC       (PubMed:27353360). Interacts (via C-terminus) with HNRNPU (via C-
CC       terminus) (PubMed:9353307). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06536,
CC       ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06537, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10477749,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10866662, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12151000,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12415108, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12686538,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15211577, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15591535,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15769988, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15941832,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16478993, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17635946,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18838540, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19141540,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21730050, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21980503,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22170608, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25775514,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:27353360, ECO:0000269|PubMed:29127155,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9154805, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9353307,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9590696}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P31749:AKT1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-296087;
CC       P59598:Asxl1 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-5743705;
CC       Q03135:CAV1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-603614;
CC       P01730:CD4; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-353826;
CC       P00533:EGFR; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-297353;
CC       P41235:HNF4A; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-1049011;
CC       P07900:HSP90AA1; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-296047;
CC       Q6ZU52:KIAA0408; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-739493;
CC       P06239:LCK; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-1348;
CC       Q62667:Mvp (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-918333;
CC       P82094:TMF1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-493507, EBI-949763;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform Alpha: Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15769988, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17635946,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18838540, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27120390,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8621628}. Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15769988,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17635946, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18838540,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:27120390, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8621628}.
CC       Mitochondrion {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21664385}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton, spindle {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25847991}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton, microtubule organizing center, centrosome
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25847991}. Note=After ligand activation,
CC       translocates from the cytoplasm to the nucleus.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18838540, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27120390,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8621628}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform Beta: Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19248771, ECO:0000269|PubMed:26711253,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8621628}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19248771, ECO:0000269|PubMed:26711253}.
CC       Note=Expressed predominantly in the nucleus with some expression
CC       also detected in the cytoplasm. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19248771,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:26711253}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform Alpha-B: Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}. Note=After ligand activation,
CC       translocates from the cytoplasm to the nucleus.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing, Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=16;
CC       Name=Alpha; Synonyms=Alpha-A, GR-alphaA;
CC         IsoId=P04150-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC         Note=Predominant physiological form.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};
CC       Name=Beta; Synonyms=Beta-A;
CC         IsoId=P04150-2; Sequence=VSP_003703;
CC       Name=Alpha-2; Synonyms=Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P04150-3; Sequence=VSP_007363;
CC         Note=Due to a partial intron retention.;
CC       Name=Beta-2;
CC         IsoId=P04150-6; Sequence=VSP_007363, VSP_003703;
CC         Note=Due to a partial intron retention.;
CC       Name=GR-A alpha;
CC         IsoId=P04150-5; Sequence=VSP_013340;
CC         Note=Lacks exons 5, 6 and 7. Found in glucocorticoid-resistant
CC         myeloma patients. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8358712};
CC       Name=GR-A beta;
CC         IsoId=P04150-7; Sequence=VSP_013340, VSP_003703;
CC         Note=Lacks exons 5, 6 and 7. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8358712};
CC       Name=GR-P;
CC         IsoId=P04150-4; Sequence=Not described;
CC         Note=Encoded by exons 2-7 plus several basepairs from the
CC         subsequent intron region. Lacks the ligand binding domain.
CC         Accounts for up to 10-20% of mRNAs.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8358712};
CC       Name=Alpha-B; Synonyms=GR-alphaB;
CC         IsoId=P04150-8; Sequence=VSP_018773;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-27 of isoform
CC         Alpha. Contains a N-acetylmethionine at position 1.
CC         {ECO:0000244|PubMed:22814378};
CC       Name=Beta-B;
CC         IsoId=P04150-9; Sequence=VSP_018773, VSP_003703;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-27 of isoform
CC         Beta. Contains a N-acetylmethionine at position 1.
CC         {ECO:0000244|PubMed:22814378, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};
CC       Name=10; Synonyms=hGRDelta313-338;
CC         IsoId=P04150-10; Sequence=VSP_043908;

CC         Alpha. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};
CC       Name=Alpha-C2; Synonyms=GR-alphaC2;

CC         Alpha. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};

CC         Alpha. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};

CC         Alpha. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};
CC       Name=Alpha-D2; Synonyms=GR-alphaD2;
CC         IsoId=P04150-15; Sequence=VSP_058313;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-331 of isoform
CC         Alpha. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};
CC       Name=Alpha-D3; Synonyms=GR-alphaD3;
CC         IsoId=P04150-16; Sequence=VSP_058312;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-336 of isoform
CC         Alpha. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15866175};
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed including bone, stomach,
CC       lung, liver, colon, breast, ovary, pancreas and kidney
CC       (PubMed:25847991). In the heart, detected in left and right atria,
CC       left and right ventricles, aorta, apex, intraventricular septum,
CC       and atrioventricular node as well as whole adult and fetal heart
CC       (PubMed:10902803). Isoform Beta: Widely expressed including brain,
CC       bone marrow, thymus, spleen, liver, kidney, pancreas, lung, fat,
CC       skeletal muscle, heart, placenta and blood leukocytes
CC       (PubMed:7769088, PubMed:8621628). Isoform Alpha-2: Expressed at
CC       low level. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10902803,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25847991, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7769088,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8621628}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Isoform Alpha: Up-regulated by TNF (at protein level).
CC       Isoform Beta: Up-regulated by TNF and becomes the predominant
CC       isoform which may lead to glucocorticoid resistance (at protein
CC       level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11381138}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Composed of three domains: a modulating N-terminal domain,
CC       a DNA-binding domain and a C-terminal ligand-binding domain
CC       (PubMed:3841189). The ligand-binding domain is required for
CC       correct chromosome segregation during mitosis although ligand
CC       binding is not required (PubMed:25847991).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25847991, ECO:0000269|PubMed:3841189}.
CC   -!- PTM: Acetylation by CLOCK reduces its binding to glucocorticoid
CC       response elements and its transcriptional activity.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19141540, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21980503}.
CC   -!- PTM: Increased proteasome-mediated degradation in response to
CC       glucocorticoids (PubMed:11555652). Isoform Alpha-B appears to be
CC       more susceptible to proteolytic degradation than isoform Alpha
CC       (PubMed:11435610). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11435610,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11555652}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated in the absence of hormone; becomes
CC       hyperphosphorylated in the presence of glucocorticoid. The Ser-
CC       203, Ser-226 and Ser-404-phosphorylated forms are mainly
CC       cytoplasmic, and the Ser-211-phosphorylated form is nuclear
CC       (PubMed:12000743, PubMed:18838540). Phosphorylation at Ser-211
CC       increases transcriptional activity (PubMed:12000743,
CC       PubMed:18483179). Phosphorylation at Ser-203, Ser-226 and Ser-404
CC       decreases signaling capacity (PubMed:12000743, PubMed:18483179,
CC       PubMed:18838540). Phosphorylation at Ser-404 may protect from
CC       glucocorticoid-induced apoptosis (PubMed:18838540).
CC       Phosphorylation at Ser-203 and Ser-211 is not required in
CC       regulation of chromosome segregation (PubMed:25847991). May be
CC       dephosphorylated by PPP5C, attenuates NR3C1 action (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06537,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12000743, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18483179,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18838540, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25847991}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylation at Lys-277 and Lys-293 negatively regulates its
CC       transcriptional activity (PubMed:12144530). Sumoylation at Lys-703
CC       positively regulates its transcriptional activity in the presence
CC       of RWDD3 (By similarity). Sumoylation at Lys-277 and Lys-293 is
CC       dispensable whereas sumoylation at Lys-703 is critical for the
CC       stimulatory effect of RWDD3 on its transcriptional activity (By
CC       similarity). Heat shock increases sumoylation in a RWDD3-dependent
CC       manner (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06536,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12144530}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated; restricts glucocorticoid-mediated
CC       transcriptional signaling. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06537}.
CC   -!- POLYMORPHISM: Carriers of the 22-Glu-Lys-23 allele are relatively
CC       more resistant to the effects of GCs with respect to the
CC       sensitivity of the adrenal feedback mechanism than non-carriers,
CC       resulting in a better metabolic health profile. Carriers have a
CC       better survival than non-carriers, as well as lower serum CRP
CC       levels. The 22-Glu-Lys-23 polymorphism is associated with a sex-
CC       specific, beneficial body composition at young-adult age, as well
CC       as greater muscle strength in males.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Glucocorticoid resistance, generalized (GCCR)
CC       [MIM:615962]: An autosomal dominant disease characterized by
CC       increased plasma cortisol concentration and high urinary free
CC       cortisol, resistance to adrenal suppression by dexamethasone, and
CC       the absence of Cushing syndrome typical signs. Clinical features
CC       include hypoglycemia, hypertension, metabolic alkalosis, chronic
CC       fatigue and profound anxiety. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11589680,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11701741, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12050230,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15769988, ECO:0000269|PubMed:1704018,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17635946, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20335448,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21362280, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23426617,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24483153, ECO:0000269|PubMed:26031419,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:26541474, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27120390,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:7683692}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Isoform Beta: High constitutive expression by
CC       neutrophils may provide a mechanism by which these cells escape
CC       glucocorticoid-induced cell death and up-regulation by
CC       proinflammatory cytokines such as IL8 further enhances their
CC       survival in the presence of glucocorticoids during inflammation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11238589}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Can up- or down-modulate aggregation and nuclear
CC       localization of expanded polyglutamine polypeptides derived from
CC       AR and HD through specific regulation of gene expression.
CC       Aggregation and nuclear localization of expanded polyglutamine
CC       proteins are regulated cellular processes that can be modulated by
CC       this receptor, a well-characterized transcriptional regulator.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10639135}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nuclear hormone receptor family. NR3
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Wikipedia; Note=Glucocorticoid receptor entry;
CC       URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glucocorticoid_receptor";

RN   [38]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.8 ANGSTROMS) OF 682-933.
RX   PubMed=9620806; DOI=10.1038/30775;
RA   Williams S.P., Sigler P.B.;

RL   Nature 393:392-396(1998).
RN   [39]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.0 ANGSTROMS) OF 676-933.
RX   PubMed=15937332; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M504144200;
RA   Zhang Z., Olland A.M., Zhu Y., Cohen J., Berrodin T., Chippari S.,
RA   Appavu C., Li S., Wilhem J., Chopra R., Fensome A., Zhang P.,
RA   Wrobel J., Unwalla R.J., Lyttle C.R., Winneker R.C.;
RT   "Molecular and pharmacological properties of a potent and selective
RT   novel nonsteroidal progesterone receptor agonist tanaproget.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 280:28468-28475(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The steroid hormones and their receptors are involved in
CC       the regulation of eukaryotic gene expression and affect cellular
CC       proliferation and differentiation in target tissues. Depending on
CC       the isoform, progesterone receptor functions as transcriptional
CC       activator or repressor. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10757795,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:1587864, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9407067,
CC       ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform A: Ligand-dependent transdominant repressor of
CC       steroid hormone receptor transcriptional activity including
CC       repression of its isoform B, MR and ER. Transrepressional activity
CC       may involve recruitment of corepressor NCOR2.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7969170, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8180103,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8264658, ECO:0000305,
CC       ECO:0000305|PubMed:10757795}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform B: Transcriptional activator of several
CC       progesteron-dependent promoters in a variety of cell types.
CC       Involved in activation of SRC-dependent MAPK signaling on hormone
CC       stimulation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7969170}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform 4: Increases mitochondrial membrane potential
CC       and cellular respiration upon stimulation by progesterone.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with SMARD1 and UNC45A. Interacts with CUEDC2;
CC       the interaction promotes ubiquitination, decreases sumoylation,
CC       and represses transcriptional activity. Interacts with PIAS3; the
CC       interaction promotes sumoylation of PR in a hormone-dependent
CC       manner, inhibits DNA-binding, and alters nuclear export. Interacts
CC       with SP1; the interaction requires ligand-induced phosphorylation
CC       on Ser-345 by ERK1/2 MAPK. Interacts with PRMT2. Isoform A
CC       interacts with NCOR2. Isoform B (but not isoform A) interacts with
CC       NCOA2 and NCOA1. Isoform B (but not isoform A) interacts with
CC       KLF9. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q00175, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10757795,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12039952, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12917342,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16478993, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17020914,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17347654, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18202149}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Self; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-78539, EBI-78539;
CC       Q9H467:CUEDC2; NbExp=9; IntAct=EBI-78539, EBI-1248228;
CC       P03372:ESR1; NbExp=20; IntAct=EBI-78539, EBI-78473;
CC       P40763:STAT3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-78539, EBI-518675;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Cytoplasm. Note=Nucleoplasmic
CC       shuttling is both hormone- and cell cycle-dependent. On hormone
CC       stimulation, retained in the cytoplasm in the G(1) and G(2)/M
CC       phases.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform A: Nucleus. Cytoplasm. Note=Mainly
CC       nuclear.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform 4: Mitochondrion outer membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23518922}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative promoter usage, Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=B; Synonyms=PRB, PR-B;
CC         IsoId=P06401-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative promoter usage.;
CC       Name=A; Synonyms=PRA, PR-A;
CC         IsoId=P06401-2; Sequence=VSP_003706;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative promoter usage.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=P06401-3; Sequence=VSP_046942;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative splicing of isoform B.;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=PR-M;
CC         IsoId=P06401-4; Sequence=VSP_047454, VSP_047455;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative promoter usage.;
CC       Name=5; Synonyms=delta4;
CC         IsoId=P06401-5; Sequence=VSP_053543;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative splicing of isoform B.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: In reproductive tissues the expression of
CC       isoform A and isoform B varies as a consequence of developmental
CC       and hormonal status. Isoform A and isoform B are expressed in
CC       comparable levels in uterine glandular epithelium during the
CC       proliferative phase of the menstrual cycle. Expression of isoform
CC       B but not of isoform A persists in the glands during mid-secretory
CC       phase. In the stroma, isoform A is the predominant form throughout
CC       the cycle. Heterogeneous isoform expression between the glands of
CC       the endometrium basalis and functionalis is implying region-
CC       specific responses to hormonal stimuli.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11041221}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Composed of three domains: a modulating N-terminal domain,
CC       a DNA-binding domain and a C-terminal ligand-binding domain.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on multiple serine sites. Several of these
CC       sites are hormone-dependent. Phosphorylation on Ser-294 occurs
CC       preferentially on isoform B, is highly hormone-dependent and
CC       modulates ubiquitination and sumoylation on Lys-388.
CC       Phosphorylation on Ser-102 and Ser-345 also requires induction by
CC       hormone. Basal phosphorylation on Ser-81, Ser-162, Ser-190 and
CC       Ser-400 is increased in response to progesterone and can be
CC       phosphorylated in vitro by the CDK2-A1 complex. Increased levels
CC       of phosphorylation on Ser-400 also in the presence of EGF,
CC       heregulin, IGF, PMA and FBS. Phosphorylation at this site by CDK2
CC       is ligand-independent, and increases nuclear translocation and
CC       transcriptional activity. Phosphorylation at Ser-162 and Ser-294,
CC       but not at Ser-190, is impaired during the G(2)/M phase of the
CC       cell cycle. Phosphorylation on Ser-345 by ERK1/2 MAPK is required
CC       for interaction with SP1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10628747,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10655479, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11110801,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15572662, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15798179,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17020914, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17173941,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17347654, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17717077,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18202149, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7476977,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8702648, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9171245}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylation is hormone-dependent and represses
CC       transcriptional activity. Sumoylation on all three sites is
CC       enhanced by PIAS3. Desumoylated by SENP1. Sumoylation on Lys-388,
CC       the main site of sumoylation, is repressed by ubiquitination on
CC       the same site, and modulated by phosphorylation at Ser-294.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10628747, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10655479,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15798179, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17020914,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17173941, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17347654,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17717077, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18202149,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8702648}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitination is hormone-dependent and represses sumoylation
CC       on the same site. Promoted by MAPK-mediated phosphorylation on
CC       Ser-294. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10628747,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10655479, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15798179,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17173941, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17717077,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18202149, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8702648}.
CC   -!- PTM: Palmitoylated by ZDHHC7 and ZDHHC21. Palmitoylation is
CC       required for plasma membrane targeting and for rapid intracellular
CC       signaling via ERK and AKT kinases and cAMP generation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22031296}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nuclear hormone receptor family. NR3
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

CC       URL="http://egp.gs.washington.edu/data/pgr/";

CC       URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progesterone_receptor";

RP   ASSOCIATION OF THE SEC61 COMPLEX WITH RIBOSOMES.
RX   PubMed=10775273; DOI=10.1093/emboj/19.8.1900;
RA   Prinz A., Behrens C., Rapoport T.A., Hartmann E., Kalies K.-U.;

RN   [9]
RP   INTERACTION WITH OST2; OST4 AND WBP1.
RX   PubMed=15831493; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M502858200;
RA   Chavan M., Yan A., Lennarz W.J.;
RT   "Subunits of the translocon interact with components of the
RT   oligosaccharyl transferase complex.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 280:22917-22924(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Part of the Sec61 complex, which is the major component
CC       of a channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein
CC       translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). The
CC       functional states of the translocon complex include co- and post-
CC       translational ER import, cotranslational membrane protein
CC       integration and retrograde transport of misfolded proteins out of
CC       the ER. In the cotranslational pathway, ribosomes synthesizing
CC       presecretory proteins are targeted to the translocon by the
CC       cytosolic signal recognition particle (SRP) and its ER-localized
CC       receptor. The association of the Sec61 complex with the ribosome
CC       is mediated by the 28S rRNA of the large ribosomal subunit. SRP-
CC       independent post-translational translocation requires the
CC       association of additional factors, such as the Sec62/63 complex
CC       and KAR2.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the heterotrimeric Sec61 complex, which is
CC       composed of SSH1, SBH1 and SSS1. Presumably three to four Sec61
CC       heterotrimers assemble into an oligomeric ring with a central
CC       aqueous pore. In cotranslational ER import, the pore diameter
CC       varies from 9-15 A in a ribosome-free resting state to 40-60 A in
CC       a functional state when associated with the ribosome. The Sec61
CC       complex is part of a channel-forming translocon complex whose
CC       composition seem to change dependent upon different functional
CC       states. During post-translational ER import the Sec61 complex
CC       associates with the Sec62/63 complex to form the Sec complex. SBH1
CC       interacts OST2, OST4 and WBP1 components of the OT complex.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15831493}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P46964:OST2; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-16410, EBI-12673;
CC       Q99380:OST4; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-16410, EBI-12689;
CC       P33767:WBP1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-16410, EBI-12658;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane; Single-pass
CC       membrane protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the SEC61-beta family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   VARIANTS CSTNU ILE-67 AND GLU-240, AND VARIANT ILE-403.
RX   PubMed=12574942; DOI=10.1007/s00439-003-0906-8;
RA   Wang J., Hegele R.A.;
RT   "Genomic basis of cystathioninuria (MIM 219500) revealed by multiple

RN   [15]
RP   CHARACTERIZATION OF VARIANTS CSTNU ILE-67 AND GLU-240, COFACTOR,
RP   BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES, AND SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=18476726; DOI=10.1021/bi800351a;
RA   Zhu W., Lin A., Banerjee R.;
RT   "Kinetic properties of polymorphic variants and pathogenic mutants in
RT   human cystathionine gamma-lyase.";
RL   Biochemistry 47:6226-6232(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the last step in the trans-sulfuration pathway
CC       from methionine to cysteine. Has broad substrate specificity.
CC       Converts cystathionine to cysteine, ammonia and 2-oxobutanoate.
CC       Converts two cysteine molecules to lanthionine and hydrogen
CC       sulfide. Can also accept homocysteine as substrate. Specificity
CC       depends on the levels of the endogenous substrates. Generates the
CC       endogenous signaling molecule hydrogen sulfide (H2S), and so
CC       contributes to the regulation of blood pressure. Acts as a
CC       cysteine-protein sulfhydrase by mediating sulfhydration of target
CC       proteins: sulfhydration consists of converting -SH groups into
CC       -SSH on specific cysteine residues of target proteins such as
CC       GAPDH, PTPN1 and NF-kappa-B subunit RELA, thereby regulating their
CC       function. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19019829,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19261609, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22169477}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: L-cystathionine + H(2)O = L-cysteine + NH(3) +
CC       2-oxobutanoate. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10212249,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19019829}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=pyridoxal 5'-phosphate; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:597326;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:10212249,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:18476726, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19019829};
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by propargylglycine, trifluoroalanine
CC       and aminoethoxyvinylglycine. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10212249,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19019829}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.5 mM for L-cystathionine {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10212249,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:18476726};
CC         KM=5.4 mM for homocysteine {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10212249,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:18476726};
CC         KM=3.5 mM for cysteine {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10212249,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:18476726};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 8.2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10212249,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:18476726};
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-cysteine biosynthesis; L-
CC       cysteine from L-homocysteine and L-serine: step 2/2.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer. Interacts with CALM in a calcium-dependent
CC       manner (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Self; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-749763, EBI-749763;
CC       Q96NT3:GUCD1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-749763, EBI-8293751;
CC       Q6P9E2:RECK; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-749763, EBI-10253121;
CC       Q96HA8:WDYHV1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-749763, EBI-741158;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P32929-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P32929-2; Sequence=VSP_006306;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=P32929-3; Sequence=VSP_047274;
CC   -!- DISEASE: Cystathioninuria (CSTNU) [MIM:219500]: Autosomal
CC       recessive phenotype characterized by abnormal accumulation of
CC       plasma cystathionine, leading to increased urinary excretion.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12574942, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18476726}.
CC       Note=The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene
CC       represented in this entry.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the trans-sulfuration enzymes family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: The MCFD2-LMAN1 complex forms a specific cargo receptor
CC       for the ER-to-Golgi transport of selected proteins. Plays a role
CC       in the secretion of coagulation factors.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12717434}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts in a calcium-dependent manner with LMAN1.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12717434, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20138881,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20142513}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P49257:LMAN1; NbExp=9; IntAct=EBI-2689785, EBI-1057738;
CC       Q15077:P2RY6; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-2689785, EBI-10235794;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate
CC       compartment {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12717434}. Endoplasmic reticulum
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12717434}. Golgi apparatus
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12717434}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8NI22-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8NI22-2; Sequence=VSP_043815;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q8NI22-3; Sequence=VSP_043814;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Essentially unstructured in the absence of calcium ions.
CC       Requires calcium ions for folding. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18590741}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Factor V and factor VIII combined deficiency 2 (F5F8D2)
CC       [MIM:613625]: A blood coagulation disorder characterized by
CC       bleeding symptoms similar to those in hemophilia or
CC       parahemophilia, that are caused by single deficiency of FV or
CC       FVIII, respectively. The most common symptoms are epistaxis,
CC       menorrhagia, and excessive bleeding during or after trauma. Plasma
CC       levels of coagulation factors V and VIII are in the range of 5 to
CC       30% of normal. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12717434,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18590741, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18685427,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20491958}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

CC       Sequence=CAD38756.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RN   [46] {ECO:0000244|PDB:5V89}

RP   DCUN1D4.
RX   PubMed=28581483; DOI=10.1038/nchembio.2386;
RA   Scott D.C., Hammill J.T., Min J., Rhee D.Y., Connelly M.,
RA   Sviderskiy V.O., Bhasin D., Chen Y., Ong S.S., Chai S.C., Goktug A.N.,
RA   Huang G., Monda J.K., Low J., Kim H.S., Paulo J.A., Cannon J.R.,

RT   "Blocking an N-terminal acetylation-dependent protein interaction
RT   inhibits an E3 ligase.";
RL   Nat. Chem. Biol. 13:850-857(2017).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Core component of multiple cullin-RING-based SCF (SKP1-
CC       CUL1-F-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complexes, which
CC       mediate the ubiquitination of proteins involved in cell cycle
CC       progression, signal transduction and transcription. SCF complexes
CC       and ARIH1 collaborate in tandem to mediate ubiquitination of
CC       target proteins (PubMed:27565346). In the SCF complex, serves as a
CC       rigid scaffold that organizes the SKP1-F-box protein and RBX1
CC       subunits. May contribute to catalysis through positioning of the
CC       substrate and the ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme. The E3 ubiquitin-
CC       protein ligase activity of the complex is dependent on the
CC       neddylation of the cullin subunit and exchange of the substrate
CC       recognition component is mediated by TIP120A/CAND1. The functional
CC       specificity of the SCF complex depends on the F-box protein as
CC       substrate recognition component. SCF(BTRC) and SCF(FBXW11) direct
CC       ubiquitination of CTNNB1 and participate in Wnt signaling.
CC       SCF(FBXW11) directs ubiquitination of phosphorylated NFKBIA.
CC       SCF(BTRC) directs ubiquitination of NFKBIB, NFKBIE, ATF4, SMAD3,
CC       SMAD4, CDC25A, FBXO5 and probably NFKB2. SCF(BTRC) and/or
CC       SCF(FBXW11) direct ubiquitination of CEP68 (PubMed:25704143,
CC       PubMed:25503564). SCF(SKP2) directs ubiquitination of
CC       phosphorylated CDKN1B/p27kip and is involved in regulation of G1/S
CC       transition. SCF(SKP2) directs ubiquitination of ORC1, CDT1, RBL2,
CC       ELF4, CDKN1A, RAG2, FOXO1A, and probably MYC and TAL1. SCF(FBXW7)
CC       directs ubiquitination of cyclin E, NOTCH1 released notch
CC       intracellular domain (NICD), and probably PSEN1. SCF(FBXW2)
CC       directs ubiquitination of GCM1. SCF(FBXO32) directs ubiquitination
CC       of MYOD1. SCF(FBXO7) directs ubiquitination of BIRC2 and DLGAP5.
CC       SCF(FBXO33) directs ubiquitination of YBX1. SCF(FBXO1) directs
CC       ubiquitination of BCL6 and DTL but does not seem to direct
CC       ubiquitination of TP53. SCF(BTRC) mediates the ubiquitination of
CC       NFKBIA at 'Lys-21' and 'Lys-22'; the degradation frees the
CC       associated NFKB1-RELA dimer to translocate into the nucleus and to
CC       activate transcription. SCF(CCNF) directs ubiquitination of
CC       CCP110. SCF(FBXL3) and SCF(FBXL21) direct ubiquitination of CRY1
CC       and CRY2. SCF(FBXO9) directs ubiquitination of TTI1 and TELO2.
CC       SCF(FBXO10) directs ubiquitination of BCL2.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15531760, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15640526,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18644861, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19679664,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22113614, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23263282,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23431138, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25503564,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25704143, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27565346,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9663463}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein ubiquitination.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of multiple SCF (SKP1-CUL1-F-box) E3 ubiquitin-
CC       protein ligase complexes formed of CUL1, SKP1, RBX1 and a variable
CC       F-box domain-containing protein as substrate-specific subunit.
CC       Component of the SCF(FBXW11) complex containing FBXW11. Component
CC       of the SCF(SKP2) complex containing SKP2, in which it interacts
CC       directly with SKP1, SKP2 and RBX1. Component of the SCF(FBXW2)
CC       complex containing FBXW2. Component of the SCF(FBXO32) complex
CC       containing FBXO32. Component of the probable SCF(FBXO7) complex
CC       containing FBXO7. Component of the SCF(FBXO10) complex containing
CC       FBXO10. Component of the SCF(FBXO11) complex containing FBXO11.
CC       Component of the SCF(FBXO25) complex containing FBXO25. Component
CC       of the SCF(FBXO33) complex containing FBXO33. Component of the
CC       probable SCF(FBXO4) complex containing FBXO4. Component of the
CC       SCF(FBXO44) complex, composed of SKP1, CUL1 and FBXO44. Component
CC       of the SCF(BTRC) complex, composed of SKP1, CUL1 and BTRC. This
CC       complex binds phosphorylated NFKBIA. Part of a SCF complex
CC       consisting of CUL1, RBX1, SKP1 and FBXO2. Component of a
CC       SCF(SKP2)-like complex containing CUL1, SKP1, TRIM21 and SKP2.
CC       Component of the SCF(FBXO17) complex, composed of SKP1, CUL1 and
CC       FBXO17. Component of the SCF(FBXO27) complex, composed of SKP1,
CC       CUL1 and FBXO27. Component of the SCF(CCNF) complex consisting of
CC       CUL1, RBX1, SKP1 and CCNF. Component of the SCF(FBXL3) complex
CC       composed of CUL1, SKP1, RBX1 and FBXL3. Component of the
CC       SCF(FBXL21) complex composed of CUL1, SKP1, RBX1 and FBXL21.
CC       Component of the SCF(FBXO9) composed of CUL1, SKP1, RBX1 and
CC       FBXO9. Component of the SCF(FBXW7) composed of CUL1, SKP1, RBX1
CC       and FBXW7. Interacts with CHEK2; mediates CHEK2 ubiquitination and
CC       regulates its function. Part of a complex with TIP120A/CAND1 and
CC       RBX1. The unneddylated form interacts with TIP120A/CAND1 and the
CC       interaction mediates the exchange of the F-box substrate-specific
CC       subunit. Can self-associate. Interacts with FBXW8. Interacts with
CC       RNF7. Interacts with CUL7; the interaction seems to be mediated by
CC       FBXW8. Interacts with TRIM21. Interacts with COPS2. Interacts with
CC       DCUN1D3. Interacts with CEP68 as part of the SCF(FBXW11) complex;
CC       the interaction is probably mediated by FBXW11 and the complex
CC       also contains CDK5RAP2 and PCNT (PubMed:25503564). Interacts (when
CC       neddylated) with ARIH1; leading to activate the E3 ligase activity
CC       of ARIH1 (PubMed:24076655, PubMed:27565346). Interacts with COPS9
CC       isoform 2 (PubMed:23776465). Interacts with UBXN1
CC       (PubMed:28152074). Interacts with KAT7, probably as part of an SCF
CC       complex; the interaction mediates KAT7 ubiquitination (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with NOTCH2 (PubMed:29149593).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9WTX6, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10230406,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10230407, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10851089,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11337588, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11961546,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12504026, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12609982,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15145941, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15537541,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15640526, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16797541,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16880511, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17098746,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18203720, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18644861,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20190741, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20596027,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21940857, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22113614,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23263282, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23431138,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23776465, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24076655,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25349211, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25503564,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:27565346, ECO:0000269|PubMed:28152074,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:29149593}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: (Microbial infection) Interacts with Epstein-Barr virus
CC       BPLF1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20190741}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: (Microbial infection) Interacts with Human adenovirus
CC       early E1A protein; this interaction inhibits RBX1-CUL1-dependent
CC       elongation reaction of ubiquitin chains by the SCF(FBXW7) complex.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19679664}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q6TVW2:- (xeno); NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-359390, EBI-15718527;

CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in lung fibroblasts.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9663463}.
CC   -!- PTM: Neddylated; which enhances the ubiquitination activity of SCF
CC       and prevents binding of the inhibitor CAND1. Deneddylated via its
CC       interaction with the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex
CC       (PubMed:10597293, PubMed:10713156, PubMed:15537541,
CC       PubMed:18805092). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10597293,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10713156, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15537541,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18805092, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20190741,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24076655, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27565346}.
CC   -!- PTM: (Microbial infection) Deneddylated by Epstein-Barr virus
CC       BPLF1 leading to a S-phase-like environment that is required for
CC       efficient replication of the viral genome (PubMed:20190741).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20190741}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the cullin family. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00330}.

RP   STRUCTURE BY ELECTRON MICROSCOPY (3.50 ANGSTROMS), AND SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=27428775; DOI=10.1038/nsmb.3273;
RA   Huang X., Luan B., Wu J., Shi Y.;

RN   [20]
RP   STRUCTURE BY ELECTRON MICROSCOPY (4.50 ANGSTROMS), AND SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=27342858; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1608050113;
RA   Schweitzer A., Aufderheide A., Rudack T., Beck F., Pfeifer G.,
RA   Plitzko J.M., Sakata E., Schulten K., Foerster F., Baumeister W.;
RT   "Structure of the human 26S proteasome at a resolution of 3.9 Aa.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 113:7816-7821(2016).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the 26S proteasome, a multiprotein complex
CC       involved in the ATP-dependent degradation of ubiquitinated
CC       proteins. This complex plays a key role in the maintenance of
CC       protein homeostasis by removing misfolded or damaged proteins,
CC       which could impair cellular functions, and by removing proteins
CC       whose functions are no longer required. Therefore, the proteasome
CC       participates in numerous cellular processes, including cell cycle
CC       progression, apoptosis, or DNA damage repair.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1317798}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the 19S proteasome regulatory particle
CC       complex. The 26S proteasome consists of a 20S core particle (CP)
CC       and two 19S regulatory subunits (RP). The regulatory particle is
CC       made of a lid composed of 9 subunits including PSMD12, a base
CC       containing 6 ATPases and few additional components.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27342858, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27428775}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=O00232-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=O00232-2; Sequence=VSP_042718;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DISEASE: Stankiewicz-Isidor syndrome (STISS) [MIM:617516]: A
CC       neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by delayed psychomotor
CC       development, intellectual disability, behavioral disorders, mild
CC       dysmorphism, ophthalmologic anomalies, feeding difficulties,
CC       deafness, and variable congenital malformations of the cardiac
CC       and/or urogenital systems. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28132691}. Note=The
CC       disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in
CC       this entry.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the proteasome subunit p55 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAH65826.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RA   Qiu X.-B., Ouyang S.-Y., Li C.-J., Miao S., Wang L., Goldberg A.L.;
